creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
inscription:
Kurehatori brings Chinese brocade
As a present to Japan 
And then return
Becoming indistinct 
Like damask in the spring mist
(Karanishsiki
Yamato miyage ni
Kurehadori
Aya ni kasumite
Tachikaeru haru)
Hinanoya Haruko

The Boar Year 
Plus one makes
Spring of the Rat Year
With just two bands 
Of mist
(I no toshi ni
Hitotsu kuwaete 
Ne no haru to
Nareba futasuji
Bakari kasumeri)
Tancho_tei Matsunari

The spider
That arranges the threads
Of spring mist 
Has become 
A Japanese master weaver
(Harugasumi
Ito wo oroshite
Yabatai no
Shisho_ to nareru
Sagami no kumo)
Yayoian Hinamaru
medium: Woodblock print (surimono); ink and color on paper
title: Chinese Princess at an Embroidery Table
